trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Reporting Notifications
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Reporting Notifications

trans-unit.source: How to use the Azure Active Directory reporting notifications for suspicious sign ins.
trans-unit.target: How to use the Azure Active Directory reporting notifications for suspicious sign ins.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Reporting Notifications
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Reporting Notifications

trans-unit.source: What reports generate email notifications
trans-unit.target: What reports generate email notifications

trans-unit.source: At this time, only the Irregular Sign in Activity report triggers email notifications.
trans-unit.target: At this time, only the Irregular Sign in Activity report triggers email notifications.

trans-unit.source: What is an "Irregular Sign in"?
trans-unit.target: What is an "Irregular Sign in"?

trans-unit.source: Irregular Sign ins are those that have been identified by our machine learning algorithms, on the basis of an "impossible travel" condition combined with an anomalous sign in location and device.
trans-unit.target: Irregular Sign ins are those that have been identified by our machine learning algorithms, on the basis of an "impossible travel" condition combined with an anomalous sign in location and device.

trans-unit.source: This may indicate that a hacker has been trying to sign in using this account.
trans-unit.target: This may indicate that a hacker has been trying to sign in using this account.

trans-unit.source: Who receives the email notifications?
trans-unit.target: Who receives the email notifications?

trans-unit.source: The email is sent to all global admins who have been assigned an Active Directory Premium license.
trans-unit.target: The email is sent to all global admins who have been assigned an Active Directory Premium license.

trans-unit.source: To ensure it is delivered, we send it to the admins Alternate Email Address as well.
trans-unit.target: To ensure it is delivered, we send it to the admins Alternate Email Address as well.

trans-unit.source: Admins should include aad-alerts-noreply@mail.windowsazure.com in their safe senders list so they don’t miss the email.
trans-unit.target: Admins should include aad-alerts-noreply@mail.windowsazure.com in their safe senders list so they don’t miss the email.

trans-unit.source: How often are these emails sent?
trans-unit.target: How often are these emails sent?

trans-unit.source: The email is sent if 10 new Irregular Sign in Activities occur in the last 30 days, or since the last email was sent, whichever is less.
trans-unit.target: The email is sent if 10 new Irregular Sign in Activities occur in the last 30 days, or since the last email was sent, whichever is less.

trans-unit.source: How do I access the report mentioned in the email?
trans-unit.target: How do I access the report mentioned in the email?

trans-unit.source: When you click on the link, you will be redirected to the report page within the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: When you click on the link, you will be redirected to the report page within the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In order to access the report, you need to be both:
trans-unit.target: In order to access the report, you need to be both:

trans-unit.source: An admin or co-admin of your Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: An admin or co-admin of your Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A global administrator in the directory, and assigned an Active Directory Premium license.
trans-unit.target: A global administrator in the directory, and assigned an Active Directory Premium license.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Azure Active Directory editions.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Azure Active Directory editions.

trans-unit.source: Can I turn off these emails?
trans-unit.target: Can I turn off these emails?

trans-unit.source: Yes, to turn off notifications related to anomalous sign ins within the Azure Management Portal, click Configure, and then select Disabled under the Notifications section.
trans-unit.target: Yes, to turn off notifications related to anomalous sign ins within the Azure Management Portal, click Configure, and then select Disabled under the Notifications section.
